content.description: A decent climb with a very difficult crux.Climb up to a miniature right-facing corner feature, cop a rest, and fire the tricky crux above to juggy runnels near the anchor.
content.protection: 6x bolts to chain anchor (bring leaver ‘biners for anchor).
content.location: Second route in from the left end of the cliff.

content.description: An excellent climb and worth the walk to the Fire Wall.A difficult pull over the low roof leads to a desperate passage up thin crimps and shallow pockets to a shake at a jug. From here a powerful sequence leads to better holds and a bit of a run to the anchor.
content.protection: 7x bolts. Anchor could benefit from quick links and mussy hooks.
content.location: Begin on a pile of cheater stones just in from the left edge of the low cave: An obvious large flat jug at the lip of the cave helps with identifying the route.

content.description: A short (60’), gently overhanging wall with a handful of very good routes. The wall faces NW and gets afternoon sun; due to its relatively low elevation this is probably best a spring/fall crag.
